intro: Calandrinia phacosperma, commonly known as the desert morning glory, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Portulacaceae family and is characterized by its erect, branching stems and vibrant pink to purple flowers. The plant produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous tiny, hard seeds. It is adapted to survive in hot, dry environments with minimal water requirements. Its succulent leaves and ability to store water make it well-suited for desert conditions.
